title: What is the Rift Herald's problem, like seriously...
body:
The thing has the weirdest behaviour...

In an earlier game, me as Kha, and another player as Darius attempted to take the monster on, we never left its spawn pit, it randomly switched between attacking me and attacking him, (we did nothing but just stand there and attack it, not even move.) and then at 1/3 heath its rage bar reached minimum because of all the switching, and it just regenerated all its health back, and we had to leave soon after that because we were both going to die to its powerful attacks.

then in this game shown in the picture, we weren't even going for it, we were trying to get the enemy kha who escaped into the pit, My attacks, Kha's attacks, and ekko's attacks all were accidentally hitting it, WW, Kha and Ekko were standing in the pit, i was standing by the entrance to the pit with my soldiers in it attacking Kha/Ekko, and for some reason the Hearald ONLY attacks me, it moves out of its spot, all the way to the entrance of the pit (even though ww, ekko and kha are right next to it and hitting it just as much as i was) i then don't like it attacking me, so i walk further away to try and change its aggro, but it follows me, and follows me, and follows me. until eventually it forced me completely out of the fight and i ran back into our jungle, AND IT STILL FOLLOWS ME, it crossed the whole river (while respawing all its health) it kept following me up until roughly were i am now in the picture. i have no idea what it had against me.

How can its behaviour not only be so random and erratic but also so different to all other monsters, Not even blue/red buff follow someone that kind of distance especially while ignoring all other champions around it, and its closest relative (Dragon) barely comes out of its pit before wanting to go back inside, and it has no rage bar either.


(now onto point 2) 


Not to mention it is the most pointless monster in all of the rift, it takes both jungle and top lane to take it, and sends both of them back to recall afterwards, which negates the buff completely because the enemy top laner has now taken your top turret, because this season turrets stand up to AD champs like Warm butter stands up to a chainsaw. 

i have seen gold junglers, (I'm only silver) battle it out over the scuttle crab while completely ignoring the low hp herald right next to them.

plus if you are the jungler, just try to convince top to come help you take the herald, they don't want anything to do with it, and frankly i don't blame them, unless you are willing to execute for them they suffer enough damage to need to recall, which puts them behind in lane, and with turrets in the sorry state that they are in this season, thats not a good thing. and god forbid you should ever find a mid laner willing to come help as well...
no one takes this monster seriously. 

i respect what riot was trying to do, but frankly it isn't working. 
i know its a powerful, lane changing buff, but no one cares about it, Every time i try get the team to come get it, they ignore me completely, and unlike dragon (and even sometimes baron) i cant take it by myself. So recently I've just started doing the same, just ignoring it completely, and tbh I've been better off. (minus of course when it chased Azir halfway across the map)

replies.body:
It has an Agro Bar like much of the jungle creeps now, whoever is closest to it has it's agro and each time that changes it loses some of it's bar.
Once the bar is depleted it will regen to full health.

yea i know that, but why would it switch aggro between kha and darius (depleting its aggro bar each time) when neither of us moved the whole time?
also you can see in the picture that it is still following me even though it has already regenerated all the health it lost, shouldn't it return to its pit while regenerating?

Likely you were switching agro the whole time, the agro bar wouldn't deplete otherwise.

As for the following, that seems to happen a lot with all jungle creeps thanks to the new agro system.

if we weren't moving though, how were we switching the aggro?
like legit question so i know not to do it next time.

You should have one sit close and one sit at their max AA range.

If shit hits the fan you can swap.
ill give that a go then

Harold just wanted to be your friend :(

But yeah, tweaking will happen as many changes have come into preseason, but I like the addition of the Herald. Once tweaks are made, it should definitely become something key to fight over for some earlier game pushing power.
